field.label: Listen Port
field.help: The port used for responding to DNS queries. It should normally be left blank unless another service needs to bind to TCP/UDP port 53.

field.label: Interface
field.help: Interface IPs used by Dnsmasq for responding to queries from clients. If an interface has both IPv4 and IPv6 IPs, both are used. Queries to other interface IPs not selected below are discarded. The default behavior is to respond to queries on every available IPv4 and IPv6 address.

field.label: Bind Mode
field.help: If this option is set, Dnsmasq will only bind to the interfaces containing the IP addresses selected above, rather than binding to all interfaces and discarding queries to other addresses. This option does not work with IPv6. If set, Dnsmasq will not bind to IPv6 addresses.

field.label: Register ISC DHCP4 Leases
field.help: If this option is set, then machines that specify their hostname when requesting a DHCP lease will be registered in Dnsmasq, so that their name can be resolved.
